Package org.wmn4j.notation

Class Measure

java.lang.Object
org.wmn4j.notation.Measure
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Durational>
public final class Measure extends Object implements Iterable<Durational>
Represents a measure. A measure may contain multiple voices that are referred to using voice numbers. This class is immutable. Use the MeasureBuilder class for easier creation of Measures.

This class is immutable.

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static Measure of(int number, Map<Integer,List<Durational>> noteVoices, TimeSignature timeSig, KeySignature keySig, Barline rightBarLine, Clef clef)
      Returns a measure with the given values.
      Parameters:
      number - number of the measure
      noteVoices - the notes on the different voices of the measure
      timeSig - TimeSignature of the measure
      keySig - KeySignature in effect in the measure
      rightBarLine - barline on the right side (left side is NONE by default)
      clef - Clef in effect in the measure
      Returns:
      a measure with the given values

      Parameters:
      number - number of the measure
      noteVoices - the notes on the different voices of the measure
      measureAttr - the attributes of the measure
      chordSymbols - the chord symbols in the measure (can be null for empty)

      Parameters:

      measureAttributes - the attributes of the measure
      chordSymbols - the chord symbols in the measure (can be null for empty)
      Returns:

    • getVoiceNumbers

      public List<Integer> getVoiceNumbers()
      Returns the voice numbers in this measure in ascending order. Voice numbers are not necessarily consecutive and do not need begin from 0.
      Returns:
      list of the voice numbers used in this measure.

    • getVoiceSize

      public int getVoiceSize(int voiceNumber)
      Returns the number of durational notation elements in the voice with the given number.
      Parameters:
      voiceNumber - the voice for which the number of elements is returned
      Returns:
      the number of elements in the voice with voiceNumber

    • getLeftBarline

      public Barline getLeftBarline()
      Returns the barline on the left side of this measure. For example, this can be a barline that denotes the beginning of a repeat.
      Returns:
      left barline of this measure

    • getClef

      public Clef getClef()
      Returns the clef in effect in the beginning of this measure.
      Returns:
      the clef in effect in the beginning of this measure

    • getClefChanges

      public List<Offset<Clef>> getClefChanges()
      Returns the clef changes in this measure.

      The placement of clef changes are represented using Offset types, where the placement of the clef change is measured by an offset from the beginning of the measure. The list is sorted in ascending order of offset.

      Returns:
      the clef changes in this measure.

    • containsClefChanges

      public boolean containsClefChanges()
      Returns true if this measure contains clef changes.
      Returns:
      true if there are clef changes in this measure, false otherwise.

    • containsDirections

      public boolean containsDirections()
      Returns true if this measure contains direction markings.

      Directions are defined by the Direction type.

      Returns:
      true if this measure contains direction markings

    • getDirections

      public List<Offset<Direction>> getDirections()
      Returns the directions in this measure.

      The placement of the directions is represented using the Offset type, measure from the beginning of the measure. The returned list is sorted in ascending order of offset.

      Returns:
      the directions in this measure

    • getChordSymbols

      public List<Offset<ChordSymbol>> getChordSymbols()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the chord symbols in this measure.

      The offsets of the chord symbols are measured from the beginning of the measure. For pickup measures, this is from the effective beginning of the measure (not the full length denoted by the time signature).

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable view of the chord symbols in this measure

    • containsChordSymbols

      public boolean containsChordSymbols()
      Returns true if this measure contains chord symbols, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if this measure contains chord symbols, false otherwise

    • isPickup

      public boolean isPickup()
      Returns true if this measure is a pickup measure.
      Returns:
      true if this measure is a pickup measure.

    • get

      public Durational get(int voiceNumber, int index) throws NoSuchElementException
      Returns the Durational at the given index on the given voice number.
      Parameters:
      voiceNumber - the number of the voice from which to get the element
      index - index of element on the voice
      Returns:
      the Durational at the given index on the given voice
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if there is no voice with the given number of if the index is out of range
